required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Tirzepatide (LY3298176) Versus Insulin Lispro (U100) in Participants With Type 2 Diabetes Inadequately Controlled on Insulin Glargine (U100) With or Without Metformin
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Phase 3, Open-label Trial Comparing the Effect of the Addition of Tirzepatide Once Weekly Versus Insulin Lispro (U100) Three Times Daily in Participants With Type 2 Diabetes Inadequately Controlled on Insulin Glargine (U100) With or Without Metformin (SURPASS-6)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the safety and efficacy of the study drug tirzepatide to insulin lispro (U100) three times a day in participants with type 2 diabetes that are already on insulin glargine (U100), with or without metformin.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) (Pooled Doses)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in HbA1c (Individual Doses)
Percentage of Participants with HbA1c Target Values <7.0%
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants with HbA1c Target Values <7.0%

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Body Weight
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in Body Weight

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Fasting Serum Glucose
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in Fasting Serum Glucose

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change from Baseline in Daily Average 7-Point Self-Monitored Blood Glucose (SMBG) Values
secondary_outcome.description: Mean Change from Baseline in Daily Average 7-Point SMBG Values

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants who Achieved HbA1c Target Value of <7.0% without Hypoglycemia
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants who Achieved HbA1c Target Value of <7.0% without Hypoglycemia

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants who Achieved Weight Loss ≥5%
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants who Achieved Weight Loss ≥5%

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in 36-Item Short Form Health Survey (SF-36) Physical Component Summary (PCS) Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in SF-36 PCS Score

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in 36-Item SF-36 Mental Component Summary (MCS) Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in SF-36 MCS Score

arm_group.description: 5 milligrams (mg) tirzepatide administered subcutaneously (SC) once a week with insulin glargine (U100) administered SC.
10 mg tirzepatide administered SC once a week with insulin glargine (U100) administered SC.
15 mg tirzepatide administered SC once a week with insulin glargine (U100) administered SC.
Insulin lispro (U100) administered SC three times a day with insulin glargine (U100) administered SC.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have been diagnosed with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM)
- Have HbA1c between ≥7.5% and ≤11%
- Have been treated for at least 90 days prior to day of screening with once or twice daily basal insulin with or without stable dose of metformin ≥1500 mg/day and up to maximum approved dose per country specific approved label, sulfonylureas or dipeptidyl peptidase 4 inhibitors
- Be of stable weight (± 5%) for at least 90 days
- Have a BMI ≥23 kilograms per meter squared (kg/m²) and ≤45 kg/m² at screening
Exclusion Criteria
- Have type 1 diabetes mellitus
- Have had chronic or acute pancreatitis any time prior to study entry
- Have proliferative diabetic retinopathy or diabetic macular edema or nonproliferative diabetic retinopathy requiring immediate or urgent treatment
- Have disorders associated with slowed emptying of the stomach, have had any stomach surgeries for the purpose of weight loss, or are chronically taking drugs that directly affect gastrointestinal motility
- Have had a heart attack, stroke, or hospitalization for congestive heart failure in the past 2 months
- Have a personal or family history of medullary thyroid carcinoma or personal history of multiple endocrine neoplasia syndrome type 2
- Have been taking weight loss drugs, including over-the-counter medications during the last 3 months
- Have an estimated glomerular filtration rate <30 mL/minute/1.73 m² [for participants on metformin, estimated glomerular filtration rate <45 mL/min/1.73 m2 (or lower than the country-specific threshold for using the protocol-required dose of metformin per local label)]

link.description: A Study of Tirzepatide (LY3298176) Versus Insulin Lispro (U100) in Participants With Type 2 Diabetes Inadequately Controlled on Insulin Glargine (U100) With or Without Metformin (SURPASS-6)

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymized individual patient level data will be provided in a secure access environment upon approval of a research proposal and a signed data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data are available 6 months after the primary publication and approval of the indication studied in the US and EU, whichever is later. Data will be indefinitely available for requesting.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: A research proposal must be approved by an independent review panel and researchers must sign a data sharing agreement.
